page.title: 18Day of a School Dinner Lady
page.content: Mrs X awakens at{6-30}and has a cup of tea. She leaves for the school at {7-50}where her daily job is to prepare the potatoes or chips which are peeled and put through a machine. Other jobs include the preparation of the other vegetables, making the custard and in general keeping the kitchens clean and tidy. At{11-30}she sets the tables for the children and at{12-05}she helps to serve the dinners. She is then allowed a half hour break for lunch before she helps with the process of cleaning up. Mrs X leaves for home at{2-45}where she attends to the housework and makes the tea for her husband and two of her children who are still at home. In the evening her hobbies include badminton, swimming and walking. Her busiest day, however, is a Sunday when all of her family of 6 plus her 7 grandchildren come to her house for tea.
